column4: Hey guys. I just installed ubuntu 12.04 yesterday and I am getting some apt errors when I try to install libgtk-3-dev from apt-get, aptitude or symantec. The errors are referring to unmet dependencies and the error is E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages. Posting full output @ http://pastebin.com/XEwZUK74. Does anyone know how I can fix this?
thanks. Let me see how that works out

same output. I have also run "apt-get clean && apt-get update && apt-get upgrade" and I have also run "dpkg --configure -a" based on some forum posts. I notice the first line of the Depends: is saying the version I have installed is newer then the version required too which I find odd
where's your error again?  (sorry too lazy too look through the scrollback)
you should use paste.ubuntu.com too many ads on pastebin.
if I use aptitude, the first suggestion is it wants to keep packages as is and not install the program I asked for. The next suggestion is downgrading packages which just seems wrong
oh I use adblocker so I didn't even know they were there
did you yo do an `apt-get install -f libgtk-3-dev` or `apt-get install -f`
oh I did `apt-get install -f libgtk-3-dev`. should I do it without the package name?
will do. btw, thanks for the help so far
he's right, -f is to 'fix broken packages', I misread your error.
it's ok. I still appreciate the help
no problem, didn't really do much ;)
you paid attention and offered support. That counts ;-)
